鉘鉘鉘

鉘字的基本解释

鉘
fú
饰。
未被公认的化学元素。1926年，两个意大利化学家以为他们发现了第61号元素，将其命名为鉘，后被否认。

鉘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fú］
［《玉篇》浮勿切］
(1)饰。
(2)1926年两位意大利化学家宣称发现的第61号元素的中文译名。他们的发现后被否定。

鉘字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鉘； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1301第15
【玉篇】浮勿切，音佛。飾也。

鉘字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鉘字的起名意思

未被公认的化学元素，也有饰的意思。

Castration
Basic explanation of words
Castration
fú
Decorated.
Unrecognized chemical element. In 1926, two Italian chemists thought they had discovered element 61 and named it Eunuch, which was later denied.
Castration
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fú］
[Floating in the Jade Chapter]
(1) Decoration.
(2) The Chinese translation of element No. 61 that two Italian chemists claimed to have discovered in 1926. Their discovery was denied.
Castration
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xu Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　鉘; Kangxi strokes: 13; Page number: page 1301 to 15
【Jade articles】Floating do not cut, sound Buddha. Decorated also.
Castration

Name meaning
Unrecognized chemical elements also have the meaning of decoration.
